name: nonconformism

religion
  specialized (also Nonconformism) in Christianity, a religious movement that is Protestant but does not belong to the Church of England: He was concerned by the growth of religious nonconformism. The growth of Nonconformism increasingly challenged the dominance of the Established Church. Synonym
nonconformity
the quality of living and thinking in a way that is different from most other people: The tech company still has the aura of hippy nonconformism. Punks embraced anarchy, rebellion, and nonconformism. Synonym
nonconformity Compare
inconformity
More examplesFewer examplesThe Act was intended to bring the established church into the new suburbs, where nonconformism was taking root.She was heavily influenced by her father's Christian nonconformism.He had a kind of nonconformism that set him apart from other scientists.Within the company there is a culture of individualism and nonconformism.
